children.content: Adds an AttributeModifier to this IIngredient.

Attributes added with this method appear on all ItemStacks that match this IIngredient, regardless of how or when the ItemStack was made, if you want to have the attribute on a single specific ItemStack (such as a specific Diamond Sword made in a recipe), then you should use IItemStack#withAttributeModifier
The Attribute of the modifier.
The name of the modifier.
The operation of the modifier.
What slots the modifier is valid for.
The value of the modifier.
Adds an AttributeModifier to this IIngredient using a specific UUID.
The UUID can be used to override an existing attribute on an ItemStack with this new modifier. You can use
to get the UUID of the attributes on an ItemStack.

Attributes added with this method appear on all ItemStacks that match this IIngredient, regardless of how or when the ItemStack was made, if you want to have the attribute on a single specific ItemStack (such as a specific Diamond Sword made in a recipe), then you should use IItemStack#withAttributeModifier
The Attribute of the modifier.
The name of the modifier.
The operation of the modifier.
What slots the modifier is valid for.
The unique identifier of the modifier to replace.
The value of the modifier.
Adds an AttributeModifier to this IIngredient using a specific UUID.
The UUID can be used to override an existing attribute on an ItemStack with this new modifier. You can use
to get the UUID of the attributes on an ItemStack.

Attributes added with this method appear on all ItemStacks that match this IIngredient, regardless of how or when the ItemStack was made, if you want to have the attribute on a single specific ItemStack (such as a specific Diamond Sword made in a recipe), then you should use IItemStack#withAttributeModifier

The name of the modifier.

The unique identifier of the modifier to replace.

When this ingredient stack is crafted, what will remain in the grid? Does not check if the stack matches though! Used e.g. in Crafting Table recipes.

Removes all AttributeModifiers that use the given Attribute from this IIngredient.

Attributes removed with this method are removed from ItemStacks that match this IIngredient, regardless of how or when the ItemStack was made, if you want to remove the attribute on a single specific ItemStack (such as a specific Diamond Sword made in a recipe), then you should use IItemStack#withoutAttribute.
This method can only remove default Attributes from an ItemStack, it is still possible that an ItemStack can override it.
The attribute to remove.
The slot types to remove it from.
Removes all AttributeModifiers who's ID is the same as the given uuid from this IIngredient.
The slot types to remove it from.
The unique id of the AttributeModifier to remove.
Removes all AttributeModifiers who's ID is the same as the given uuid from this IIngredient.
The slot types to remove it from.
The unique id of the AttributeModifier to remove.

true if this ItemStack can contain more than one item.

Adds an AttributeModifier to this IItemStack using a specific UUID.
The UUID can be used to override an existing attribute on an ItemStack with this new modifier. You can use
to get the UUID of the attributes on an ItemStack.
Attributes added with this method will only appear on this specific IItemStack.
By defaults, adding a modifier will remove the default Attribute Modifiers on the Item, like the Diamond Chestplate's Armor and Toughness values. When
is set to true (by default it is false.), the default Attribute Modifiers will be preserved when adding this modifier. This means that if you were adding the
attribute to an Item, it would keep its default attributes (like Armor and Toughness values).
The Attribute of the modifier.
The name of the modifier.
The operation of the modifier.
Should the default Item Attribute Modifiers be preserved when adding this modifier.
What slots the modifier is valid for.
The unique identifier of the modifier to replace.
The value of the modifier.
